content: billboard by barbara hurd this soft thick warm beanie is made from two-ply homespun malabrigo wool i intentionally left the gorgeous colors unblended for a unique artistic look every hat will be different if you do this i ordered the labels then applied them after the knitting was complete you can also use the ones that are sewn on if they are small some yarn shops carry them you could sew two next to each other for wider coverage the reverse is true you could make the placket area on the hat smaller for a smaller label yarn malabrigo nube 2 ply-homespun approximately 175 yards needles 7us circs 7us double pointed for the crown guage 16 sts/4inches in stockinette sizes s m l 18 in 20 in 22 in head circumference cast on 72 80 88 sts place marker #1 join and *k1 p1 for 32 sts pm #2 knit 15 sts in stockinette all knit pm #3 *p1 k1 to the last sts before marker and p1 continue in *k1 p1 ribbing and stockinette between 2nd and 3rd markers for 2 5 inches or desired height purl 2 rounds removing the 2nd and 3rd markers change to stockinette sts and continue until 6 5 inches from start or desired height before crown crown row 1 *k2 k2tog around row 2-3 knit row 4 *k1 k2tog around row 5-6 knit row 7 8 9 k2tog around cut yarn leaving long tail thread tail through all sts twice sew in loose end on inside sew in all loose ends on the inside flip hat sew or snap label on securely gift away copyright 2025 barbara hurd
